question:
Music plays a vital role in our society.


How much has music influenced the way we think today? What do you think is key role of music in nowadays world?
text: Music is one of the most ancient types of entertainment. In this day and age, it plays a huge part in human beings’ lives together with forming subcultures like rockers, hippies and so on. Therefore, it is so charming to go into detail about the influence of music heritage on modern societies.

Firstly, there is no doubt that music made a significant contribution to setting people’s emotions as well as shaping their thinking over the ages. To put it more simply, each sound one heard would produce a particular feeling, by way of illustration, excitement, sadness or even anger. For instance, such noises as crashing waves, the singing of birds or the babbling stream of a river will soothe one. What is more, individuals subconsciously adopt a position stated in the lyrics of the song which they listen to on repeat. As an example, if one sticks his playlist with a plethora of romantic songs, the topic of love will become more sacred for him.

Regarding the importance of music in various cultures, from my point of view, these days music is not one-legged. In other words, people used to listen to pieces of music in their spare time in pubs, restaurants and other institutions targeted to fulfil weary individuals. However, nowadays it is becoming an undeniable part of one’s casual pastime, inasmuch as people are getting used to listening to background music literally everywhere they go. Evidence for this is provided in groundbreaking research carried out by sociologists from Cambridge University which concluded that over 20% of the English were enjoying their favourite tracks while taking a shower.
Taking everything into consideration, music has been increasing its impact on social groups throughout the entire history of humanity.
